metadata.subject: Baylor University sexual assault scandal and crisis response

relationships.description: Head coach who built Baylor into a national football powerhouse
Football player transferred from Boise State who was convicted of sexual assault
Law firm hired to conduct independent investigation reporting directly to special committee

analysis.purpose: To provide the author's perspective on Baylor University's handling of sexual assault cases and defend the institution's response efforts
analysis.significance: First-hand account from university leadership during major sexual assault scandal that resulted in coaching changes and institutional reforms

concerns: Institutional failure to properly handle sexual assault reports
Criminal sexual assault convictions involving student-athletes

notable_quotes: The findings were deeply troubling. Moral outrage was the order of the day, throughout the country.
The devastating conclusion – a fundamental failure of the institution itself – echoed throughout campus and demoralized Baylor Nation.
Several of us, including Coach Art Briles, an honorable and decent man (and football genius) would be fatally hit by the media's unrelenting fusillade.
red_flags: Pattern of sexual assault cases involving football players
Institutional failure in handling assault reports
First responders described as 'insensitive' to sexual violence reports
Off-campus behavior jurisdictional limitations cited as concern

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion found in this document

illegal_activity.description: Document discusses legal proceedings and institutional responses to criminal activity but contains no first-hand evidence of illegal activity by the author

details: Texas Monthly published critical piece alleging 'rape culture' in football program
ESPN's 'Outside the Lines' conducted investigative reporting on the scandal
Mainstream media coverage described as 'unrelenting fusillade'

public_knowledge.context: The Baylor University sexual assault scandal was widely covered in national media and resulted in significant institutional changes including coaching dismissals

analysis.summary: This document is a first-hand account from Baylor University leadership describing the institutional response to sexual assault allegations against football players, the Pepper Hamilton investigation that found 'fundamental failure' in handling cases, and the author's defense of the university's prevention efforts while acknowledging shortcomings in responding to reports.
